results.title: Rushmore [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Wes Anderson, Barry Mendel, Paul Schiff and American Empirical Pictures
results.brief_description: Max Fisher (Jason Schwartzman) is a highly eccentric 10th grade student at Rushmore Academy whose life is altered when he meets and falls in love with the elegant Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a recently widowed first grade teacher. Max finds himself caught in a strange love triangle when his close friend Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), a wealthy steel tycoon also falls for Miss Cross. Written by Wes Anderson and Owen Wilson, this films addresses the intricate relationships that evolve between students, teachers, friends and family.

results.title: Beyond the Big Issue : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Nine of Melbourne’s homeless and disabled share the stories of their lives and talk about how The Big Issue has changed their circumstances. They also talk about their interests, friends, family, daily struggles and how working for the Big Issue has helped restore dignity to their lives.

results.title: Rusalka
results.creator_credit: Derek Bailey, David Pountney, Landseer Film and Television Productions and RM Arts
results.brief_description: Lyrical fairytale in three acts of a water-nymph who falls in love with a human prince by Antonin Dvorak, libretto by Jaroslav Kvapil, produced by David Pountney and performed at the London Coliseum by the English National Opera Orchestra and Chorus conducted by Mark Elder. Features Eilene Hannan (Rusalka), John Treleaven (the Prince), Rodney Macann (the Water Spirit), Ann Howard (Jezibaba), Phyllis Cannan (the Foreign Princess), along with Cathryn Pope, Eileen Hulse, and Linda McLeod as the Wood-Nymphs. The simple but effective Victorian nursery setting with its fairytale atmosphere is designed by Stephanos Lazaridis.

results.title: Running time
results.creator_credit: Mort Ransen, Colin Low, George Pearson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This feature film is an exotic romp through the ‘60s in song and dance. A fantasy that pokes fun not only at some hallowed institutions but at itself as well. The friendship between an old lady and a young man sets off a chain of events that involves a number of well-intentioned middle-aged individuals in some outrageously bizarre situations. A parodic exposition of 1960’s social mores. While the film benefits from its elaborate arsenal of experimental cinematic techniques - split screen images, freeze frames, solarisation and multiple exposures, rapid edits - the narrative is disrupted by a succession of musical numbers. Unlike to so much else in the film, the music and acting styles are somewhat conventional, and detract from what might otherwise be the Canadian counterpart to Vera Chytilova’s “Daisies”.

results.title: Running out of time
results.creator_credit: Johnnie To and Milky Way Image
results.brief_description: A tenacious cop pursues a jewel thief with 72 hours to live who decides to pull off one last heist. In what has become a generic convention of the Hong Kong action film, the two develop a sense of empathy and mutual respect as they engage in a series of mind games that become increasingly complicated as the narrative moves towards a final showdown. With its sparse dialogue and moody, cool cinematography, the film is markedly restrained compared to To’s earlier work. Cast includes Andy Lau and Lau Ching-Wan. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Rugrats in Paris: the movie = Rugrats II
results.creator_credit: Paul Demeyer, Stig Bergqvist, Arlene Klasky, Gabor Csupo, GmbH and Co, MFP Munich Film Partners GmbH and Rugrats Production KG
results.brief_description: When Angelica catches a few scenes from the “The Godfather” on television, she takes it upon herself to become the Bubfather and grants wishes to her fellow Rugrats. Chuckie’s wish is to have a new mother. Not long after, Stu Pickles receives an emergency call to travel to Europetarland, France, to repair a faulty Raptor and pacify rampaging theme park director, Coco LaBouche. He’s invited to bring family and friends for company and the Rugrats find themselves in Paris. In an effort to gain a promotion and become company president, the child hating Coco makes a play for Chuckie’s hapless father Chas in a desperate attempt to win favour with the outgoing President. Only Angelica knows of Coco’s cunning plan and it’s up to the Rugrats to save Chas, imperilling a few famous landmarks along the way. Humorous throughout, the film has a strong sense of familial values and what constitutes “good” parenting. Features the voices of Susan Sarandon, John Lithgow, Debbie Reynolds, Christine Cavanaugh, Elizabeth Daily and Cheryl Chase.

results.title: Rugby rouses me
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Fletcher, John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates
results.brief_description: Explores the game of Rugby in Australia at many levels and reveals the dedication, even fanaticism that Rugby engenders alike in players, organisers and supporters. Follows the stages of junior competition, selection trials, state and international competition. Also shows the camaraderie and life-long friendships that are built up amongst the players.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David E. Barrow, Peter Fletcher, John Leake, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Motion Picture Associates

results.title: Royal Flying Doctor Service: Broken Hill
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray, Ron Hannam and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at the activities of the section of the Royal Flying Doctor Service based at Broken Hill in outback New South Wales. Presents a dramatisation in which a doctor joins the service and is given an introduction to the operational methods of the Broken Hill Base. The vast outback area which must be covered and the people who are the potential patients are made known to the new doctor.

results.title: Roy Lichtenstein
results.brief_description: Featuring a rare and lengthy interview with Roy Lichtenstein discussing his work, past and present, and his career, this documentary offers a comprehensive insight into one of the pioneers of Pop Art in the United States. The program documents the rise to record prices of Lichtenstein’s work and his steadily built reputation as one of the world’s foremost contemporary artists for the breadth and depth of his paintings. The impact of his work, its critical status in the contemporary art world and his contribution to the pop art movement are all discussed through the interviews with Lichtenstein himself as he is seen working on paintings in his studio in New York. Such notions are also approached through interviews with long-time supporters, gallery owners and curators and art critics to provide a thorough study of the man and his work.
